item.content:encoded: Morning Bell: Obama Doesn't Just Gut Welfare Reform, He Turns It Upside Down http://t.co/sGJxovwp via @heritage #tcot The controversy over the Obama Administration’s gutting of welfare reform continues to grow. Two new government reports show the move’s illegality and effects on taxpayers. And the House of Representatives is set to vote today to approve or disapprove Health and Human Services’ (HHS) rewriting of the 1996 law. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Carney says 'self evident' Benghazi attack was terrorism, despite claims it was spontaneous
item.description: Carney says 'self evident' Benghazi attack was terrorism, despite claims it was spontaneous http://t.co/UeiwWTut #tcot #p2 #fem2
item.content:encoded: Carney says 'self evident' Benghazi attack was terrorism, despite claims it was spontaneous http://t.co/UeiwWTut #tcot #p2 #fem2 The White House, after insisting for more than a week that the attack on the U.S. Consulate in Benghazi was a spontaneous act, conceded Thursday that it was self evident it was an act of terror. It took eight days for any administration official to use that term -- earlier in the week, a top State Department spokeswoman declined to label the attack terrorism. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: foxnews.com

item.title: AskPatents.com: A Stack Exchange To Prevent Bad Patents « Blog – Stack Exchange
item.description: http://t.co/7s7cLdJd: A Stack Exchange To Prevent Bad Patents http://t.co/w9SlzeOj
item.content:encoded: http://t.co/7s7cLdJd: A Stack Exchange To Prevent Bad Patents http://t.co/w9SlzeOj We’ve all heard the stories of seemingly trivial patents being used to mug technology companies. There was the patent on the “Interactive Web” which a troll named Eolas used to extract $521 million from Microsoft–until a jury in East Texas threw out the patents. There are the four patents Lodsys is using to send threatening letters to software developers everywhere–trivial patents that Google says never should have been granted, in fact, Google and Oracle have submitted mountains of prior art to show that the patents should be Link - Trackbacks

News http://t.co/0gJAbH8H via @YahooNews From the blog The Ticket: Tim Pawlenty quit as co-chair of Mitt Romney's presidential campaign on Thursday to become one of Wall Street's top lobbyists in Washington. Pawlenty, a former governor of Minnesota, will lead the Financial Services Roundtable. The move came with Romney's campaign struggling to find its stride with just seven weeks left before Election Day. Polls show [...] Link - Trackbacks

item.title: 'Running Out Of Time': Arctic Sea Ice Loss Hits Record Low
item.description: Arctic Sea Ice Levels Hit Record Low, Scientists Say We're 'Running Out Of Time': As Arctic sea ice levels hit a... http://t.co/f5TF41Ky
item.content:encoded: Arctic Sea Ice Levels Hit Record Low, Scientists Say We're 'Running Out Of Time': As Arctic sea ice levels hit a... http://t.co/f5TF41Ky As Arctic sea ice levels hit a new record low this month, scientists and activists gathered to discuss how to bridge the gap between scientific facts and the public's limited understanding that we are, in their words, "really running out of time." The National Snow and Ice Data Center (NSIDC) released preliminary findings Wednesday suggesting that on Sept. 16, Arctic ice covered just 1.32 million square miles -- the lowest extent ever recorded. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com
